description: Creates an immutable version of the bot. When you create the first version of a bot, Amazon Lex sets the version number to 1. Subsequent bot versions increase in an increment of 1. The version number will always represent the total number of versions created of the bot, not the current number of versions. If a bot version is deleted, that bot version number will not be reused.

parameters.name: botId
parameters.description: The identifier of the bot to create the version for.

parameters.name: botVersionLocaleSpecification
parameters.description: Specifies the locales that Amazon Lex adds to this version. You can choose the Draft version or any other previously published version for each locale. When you specify a source version, the locale data is copied from the source version to the new version. (string) --- (dict) --- The version of a bot used for a bot locale. The version of a bot used for a bot locale.

nested_params.name: sourceBotVersion
nested_params.description: The version of a bot used for a bot locale.

nested_items.name: botId
nested_items.description: The bot identifier specified in the request.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the version specified in the request.

nested_items.name: botVersion
nested_items.description: The version number assigned to the version.

nested_items.name: botVersionLocaleSpecification
nested_items.description: The source versions used for each locale in the new version.

nested_items.name: sourceBotVersion
nested_items.description: The version of a bot used for a bot locale.

nested_items.name: botStatus
nested_items.description: When you send a request to create or update a bot, Amazon Lex sets the status response element to Creating. After Amazon Lex builds the bot, it sets status to Available. If Amazon Lex can't build the bot, it sets status to Failed.

nested_items.name: creationDateTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp of the date and time that the version was created.
